security_audit.summary: This is a pure markdown documentation file with no executable code, scripts, or network capabilities. The skill defines prompt templates and tool descriptions for a Proxmox monitoring MCP integration.

content.user_title: Monitor Proxmox infrastructure health and performance
content.value_statement: Managing Proxmox infrastructure requires tracking multiple nodes, VMs, and containers. This skill provides unified access to cluster metrics, helping you identify bottlenecks and optimize resource allocation across your environment.
actual_capabilities: Get node statistics and performance metrics
Monitor CPU, memory, and disk utilization across the cluster
Track VM and container performance data
limitations: Requires Proxmox VE MCP server to be configured and running
Cannot modify resources, only read metrics
Historical data depends on MCP server configuration
Network performance monitoring requires additional storage tool

use_cases.title: Cluster Health Monitoring
use_cases.description: Get comprehensive health status of all nodes and workloads in your Proxmox cluster

use_cases.title: Performance Bottleneck Detection
use_cases.description: Identify which nodes, VMs, or containers are causing performance issues

use_cases.title: Capacity Planning and Forecasting
use_cases.description: Analyze resource trends to plan infrastructure scaling and upgrades

prompt_templates.title: Quick Health Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the current cluster health and performance status

prompt_templates.title: Resource Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Which nodes are running at high CPU or memory utilization

prompt_templates.title: VM Performance Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me performance metrics for all virtual machines

prompt_templates.title: Full Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a complete performance analysis report for my Proxmox cluster including node status, VM metrics, and optimization recommendations

output_examples.input: Show me the current cluster health and performance status
output: CPU Usage: 3 nodes above 80% threshold (node-02 at 92%)
Memory: 45% average across cluster, 2 nodes in high utilization
Storage: 68% average capacity used, datastores healthy
Recommendations: Consider migrating workloads from node-02 to reduce CPU pressure

best_practices: Establish baseline metrics before making infrastructure changes
Set alert thresholds for CPU, memory, and storage utilization
Review metrics regularly to identify gradual performance degradation
Use historical trends to inform capacity planning decisions
anti_patterns: Waiting until resources are at 100% before investigating
Ignoring gradual increases in resource utilization over time
Making changes without comparing before and after metrics
Monitoring only one resource type while others become constrained

faq.question: Which Proxmox versions are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Proxmox VE 7.x and 8.x through the Proxmox VE MCP server integration.

faq.question: How frequently are metrics updated?
faq.answer: Metric freshness depends on your MCP server configuration. Check your server settings for update intervals.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with external monitoring tools?
faq.answer: This skill reads from Proxmox MCP. Export metrics to Grafana, Prometheus, or other tools via their respective integrations.

faq.question: Is my Proxmox data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. The skill queries your local Proxmox MCP server. Data stays within your infrastructure.

faq.question: Why am I getting authentication errors?
faq.answer: Ensure your Proxmox MCP server is configured with valid credentials and can reach your Proxmox API endpoint.

faq.question: How does this compare to Proxmox's built-in monitoring?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-powered analysis and natural language summaries. Use both tools together for comprehensive coverage.
